title: Tyson Fury ambushed by Braun Strowman during WWE training session
text:
The Gypsy King went down clutching his ankle after being blind-sided (Picture: WWE/YouTube)

The animosity between Tyson Fury and Braun Strowman ramped up another notch after the heavyweight boxer was ambushed during training for their WWE Crown Jewell face-off at the end of the month.

The two man mountains will clash in Saudi Arabia on October 31, with Fury undergoing intensive training at the WWE Performance Centre to get ready for the fight.

But during a recent session, Strowman snuck into the ring and blind-sided the lineal heavyweight champion, leaving him clutching his ankle on the floor.

Strowman landed a huge hit on Fury to the stunned reaction of onlookers (Picture: WWE/YouTube)

Fury was mid-practice when Strowman, real name Adam Scherr, appeared out of nowhere and landed a huge hit on the Gypsy King, who tried to get up and retaliate but was held back.

While the rest of the wrestlers in attendance chastised Strowman for his actions – one shouting, ‘You idiot, you could have broke his leg!’ – he simply stood and laughed at Fury.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Strowman exited the building yelling, ‘You’re in my world now’ as Fury tried to chase him down, but he seemed perturbed by his ankle injury as the trainers called for a medic.

‘I don’t need no medicals, I’ll be alright,’ said a furious Fury, before launching a tirade at Strowman as he made his exit. ‘I’ll see you in Saudi you big bum! Dosser!’

Fury has made the surprise move into WWE as he awaits a long-anticipated rematch with WBC heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder, which is scheduled for February 2020.

Strowman simply stood and laughed as Fury lay on the ground clutching his ankle (Picture: WWE/YouTube)

He had attended WWE Smackdown when he felt he was insulted by Strowman, with their feud escalating at Raw when a brawl broke out, and they will finally settle their differences for good at the end of the month in Riyadh.

Speaking about the move into wrestling, Fury said: ‘Getting invited here, people say “WWE is fake, it’s this it’s that”, when I got here it was a hard reality. It’s the most physical, taxing sport I’ve ever been involved in.

‘I’ve only had a few days training, this is a really, really physical, damaging, brutalising sport. It’s really opened my eyes to how athletic these guys really are.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It’s a contact sport, there’s going to be injuries. I’m not worried. I’m a prize fighter, a fighting man. I’m the Gypsy King. I’ve been fighting my whole life, this is just another step along the road of fighting.’
description: The animosity between Tyson Fury and Braun Strowman ramped up another notch after the heavyweight boxer was ambushed during training for their WWE Crown Jewell face-off at the end of...
